result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda K Engel

defendant.name: Engel, Amanda K
defendant.address: W816 Shorewood Drive, East Troy, WI 53120

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda K Engel in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Amanda K Engel.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 1:53 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status on all files. Record by Atty. as to new offer given this morning and asks for one final status. Court grants request, but matters will be set for trial if not resolved at next status. Further record as to bond refund previously ordered. $12, 500 was to be refunded, but only $5,000.00 was disbursed. Court orders additional $7500.00 returned to poster. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Court adopted stipulation of the parties to return 1/2 of the $10,000.00 to the poster. All other conditions of bond remain the same.

Defendant Amanda K Engel in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Amanda K Engel.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:43 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for bond motion hearing as to all files - 21CF482, 21CF632, 22CF281, and 22CF336. Record by Atty. Renner that the State is stipulating to 1/2 of the cash posted being returned to the poster. Court adopts stipulation and 1/2 of cash bond will be returned. Further record by Atty. Renner as to lack of offer from the State. State will get offer to DE within the next 30 days. Court sets out for status in 60 days.
Status Conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Amanda K Engel in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Amanda K Engel. Called @ 3:25 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 6th status on 21CF482, 21CF632, and 1st status on 22CF281 and 22CF336. Record by Atty. Renner as to bond motion filed on this case. ADA Herrmann is asking for more time to review. Bond has been posted, but the amount put strain on family's finances, and Atty. Renner is hoping bond money or part of bond money can be refunded to the poster. Court sets matter over a few weeks to give Atty. Herrmann chance to review motion to modify bond. Court in recess.
Motion hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(6405) Defendant in court in custody via video with attorney Mackenzie Renner. ADA Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing on 22CF336 & 22CF281; 21CF482 & 21CF632 are tracking. State calls Officer Joseph Medina duly sworn by clerk and responds to direct exam of ADA Herrmann. Witness identifies defendant; record to reflect accurate ID of defendant. State's exhibit #1 for both files offered and ID;d. No objection by defense Atty Renner subject to cross. 
244 pm Cross exam by Atty Renner
250 pm Witness excused. State rests. 
251 pm Argument by ADA Herrmann, Argument by Atty Renner and objecting to bind over
252 pm Court finds probable cause felony has been committed and matter bound over for trial. Information filed. Not guilty pleas entered and trial reserved. All matters set over for Status Hearing before Judge Reddy.
Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amanda K Engel in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Amanda K Engel. Attorney Renner just appointed and needs additional time. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

$10,000 ALREADY POSTED, MUST POST $15,000

BOND TO COVER 22CF336, 22CF281, 21CF632 & 21CF482

NO DRIVING AT ALL. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amanda K Engel in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner for defendant. Attorney Renner states she has medical proof of Defendant's medical condition. Total bond set, $25,000 cash. $10,000 already posted, must post $15,000. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
